name: 'The Black Vera Wang' Quiz | 'West Wing' - Season 3 | 10 Questions

questions.text: When the episode began, where was the staff coming back from?
questions.explanation:
Helsinki.

	Ginger was the person who mentioned that the staff went to Helsinki, but CJ mentioned they went to Helsinki because of a reactor.

questions.text: Sam said he didn't like to eat anything that could talk and hatch a plan.
questions.explanation:
True.

	Ginger asked Sam if he ate a moose and Sam said, "No, I don't like eating things where the cartoon character can talk, and you know, hatch a plan." Ginger agreed.

questions.text: What part of CJ's car did Simon hold up to show her that she couldn't drive it home?
questions.explanation:
Spark plug.

	CJ wanted to drive home in her baby blue 1965 Mustang, but Simon wouldn't let her because they dismantled the car. He told her she could use the wiper fluid, but then he said she couldn't because he had the battery.

questions.text: Who did Josh promise to return to?
questions.explanation:
Donna.

	Donna told Josh she missed him most during the nights, and he showed her the burnt pine wood box of sauna-soaked moose meat he brought her from Helsinki.

questions.text: Which king did the President tell Charlie the play "War of the Roses" was based on?
questions.explanation:
Henry.

	The President told Charlie the play was based on Henry V, Henry VI,  and Henry VIII. The play is four to five hours long.

questions.text: What nickname did CJ have for Simon?
questions.explanation:
Sunshine.

	After CJ gave him the nickname, Simon corrected her by saying, "It's Special Agent Sunshine."

questions.text: Which assistant sold their moose meat on eBay.com?
questions.explanation:
None of them sold it.

	The moose meat was up to $180 on eBay.com when Josh found out about it. Donna told him she had given it to an intern so Josh wanted the intern fired. Instead, Donna had Bruce transferred and since he couldn't reimburse her for the money paid getting the moose meat off eBay, she was out $210 dollars and had moose meat she didn't want in the first place.

questions.text: What target did the Qumari defense minister target?
questions.explanation:
Fort Point.

	Fort Point was going to be blown up because it was underneath the Golden Gate bridge.

questions.text: Why did Kevin Kahn give the Bartlet attack ad to the news media?
questions.correct: Because of the open mic incident
options: Because Josh offended him with a joke
questions.explanation:
Because of the open mic incident.

	Bruno, Josh, and Toby told Sam not to go to Kevin with the attack ad, but Sam did anyway because they were friends. When Bruno told Sam that Kevin took the ad to the media, Sam approached Kevin about it and found out it was because of the President's comment on Governor Ritchie. Sam told Kevin to expect it to happen again.

questions.text: Simon told Hogan and CJ he was at Rosslyn when the shooting occurred.
questions.explanation:
True.

	Simon told Hogan while they were shopping, and then he told CJ at the office. Hogan called him a good guy and CJ simply thanked him.
